quest.name: An Ally for Ishgard
journal: Alphinaud is eager to hear what tidings Ser Aymeric has to share.

It would seem that Ser Aymeric has a favor to ask. Now that Nidhogg is possessed of both of his eyes, the lord commander believes that there is only one being capable of standing against the vengeful shade─Nidhogg's own brood-brother, Hraesvelgr. As such, he would have you escort him to Zenith, and aid him in convincing the great wyrm to stand with Ishgard. Though Alphinaud harbors understandable doubts as to the wisdom of this course, it is plain that Ser Aymeric will not be swayed. Notify the lord commander when you are ready to depart.

Though Ser Aymeric is ready to ascend Sohm Al, he acquiesces to Alphinaud's suggestion that you first visit Vidofnir at Anyx Trine. Travel to the Dravanian forelands, and speak with the wounded dragon.

Vidofnir dismisses your concern regarding her injury, but can offer little in the way of hope for your intended audience with her sire. Disheartened but not dissuaded, Ser Aymeric resolves to press on into the Churning Mists.
objectives: Speak with Vidofnir in Anyx Trine.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Hmmm... Might Ser Aymeric perchance have received word of a Dravanian advance?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: ...Or mayhap they have located Esti─ That is to say, mayhap Nidhogg has been found!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Come! I would hear what the lord commander has to say!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I somehow doubt that Hraesvelgr will be pleased to see us. But for Estinien's sake, and that of countless others, I suppose we must risk his displeasure.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: I think I'll stay here at the Knight for the time being. After all, the rumors are fresh and the extra coin won't go amiss!

dialogue.name: AYMERIC
dialogue.text: It grieves me to impose upon you in this manner, but you of all people understand the threat we now face.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: It is no imposition, Ser Aymeric─to Forename and I, Ishgard is as a second home.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: After the many battles we have fought and the bonds we have forged, the plight of your nation has become our own. If there is aught that we can do to aid in its salvation, then pray impose all you must.

dialogue.name: AYMERIC
dialogue.text: You are true friends...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Shall we be about our task, then? We have no way of knowing when Nidhogg's shade will strike, but we must assume that time is not our ally.

dialogue.name: AYMERIC
dialogue.text: Indeed. With that in mind, I have taken the liberty of dispatching a messenger to inform Mistress Tataru that you will be escorting me to Sohm Al. I confess, I did not provide the exact details of our destination, as they are as yet unknown to me...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We will summon Hraesvelgr at Zenith in the Churning Mists. Ere we begin our ascent, however, I think it best that we pay a visit to Anyx Trine.

dialogue.name: AYMERIC
dialogue.text: You seek an advantage in the coming negotiations?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I do. I would consult with Vidofnir.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I propose this in part out of concern for her condition. Were she to succumb to her wounds, it could have grave consequences for our alliance. That apart, she may be able to provide insight into her sire's current state of mind.

dialogue.name: AYMERIC
dialogue.text: Well reasoned. To the Dravanian forelands, then.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: A nice young knight told me you were off to negotiate with Hraesvelgr again. Have you considered using the Manderville art of parley? It's surprisingly effective, you know!

dialogue.name: VIDOFNIR
dialogue.text: Ah, 'tis the warrior of warriors and herhis companions. What bringeth you to mine abode?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Pray forgive us for disturbing your recuperation, Vidofnir. I hope your wound does not pain you overmuch...

dialogue.name: VIDOFNIR
dialogue.text: Didst thou imagine me close to death? The thrust was deep, but not mortal. I will heal in time.

dialogue.name: AYMERIC
dialogue.text: Full glad am I to hear it. You were the guest of honor at our conference, and we failed in our duty of protection. On behalf of Ishgard, I apologize unreservedly.

dialogue.name: VIDOFNIR
dialogue.text: ...I am a dragon full-grown, and thou thought to protect me, mortal? I was tempered by the fires of battle ere thy great-grandsire learned to crawl.

dialogue.name: VIDOFNIR
dialogue.text: Thy words do remind me of a knight whom I called friend some thousand years past. He swore to defend me from harm and hardship...

dialogue.name: AYMERIC
dialogue.text: Would that we could return to that era of peace, when man and dragon knew such comradeship.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Would that our every effort to do so were not undone by ancient rancor...

dialogue.name: VIDOFNIR
dialogue.text: For a truth, there can be no peace while Nidhogg's shade yet lingereth.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: That much is plain─yet we lack the strength to banish him. Thus do we make for Sohm Al, to beseech the aid of your sire once more.

dialogue.name: VIDOFNIR
dialogue.text: Folly. Thou know'st as well as I how he will answer.

dialogue.name: AYMERIC
dialogue.text:
...Hraesvelgr's heart remains unchanged, then. A pity.
But if it is folly to hope, I am content to die a fool.

dialogue.name: VIDOFNIR
dialogue.text: As hath ever been the way with thy kind. Go then, but be warned: the shade's presence hath driven its minions to frenzy.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Thank you, Vidofnir. We shall disturb your rest no longer.
